column4: Anyone have experience with Firefox/Flash sound not working in Karmic?
Several ways so far actually haha
I've tried through synaptic, and the AMD64 alpha script on the forums
Then again I didnt uninstall flash before trying the script..
Thing is, Flash sound worked on the Live CD
But not when I upgraded my Jaunty to Karmic
No I have not seen that kinja I'll check it out
But how can I tell if the Firefox I'm running is 64bit?
bottom line in "help - About firefox" Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.1.4) Gecko/20091028 Ubuntu/9.10 (karmic) Firefox/3.5.4
there are a few people having that problem with PulseAudio
change to alsa (http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=8217190#post8217190) and see if it helps
but what's weird is that upgrading to Karmic has solved other PulseAudio problems I had, with XBMC
let me know. It took me 3 days to figure out how to get rid of pulse lol
ORLY?? how did you manage that??
so did i, but karmic shoved pulse down my throat when i upgraded
what sound card do you have?
unfortunately i dont know how much help i can be in this case. i just know the many headaches that pulse gave me when i upgraded, including a random "ticking" when the speakers were muted
did you add the firefox ppa to your repository?
